title: The Zero Product Property
text: The zero product property says if the product of two quantities is zero, it must be that at least one of the quantities is zero.
speech: The zero product property says if the product of two quantities is zero, it must be that at least one of the quantities is zero.
pacedSpeech: The zero product property says if the product of two quantities is zero, it must be that at least one of the quantities is zero.

title: Factoring the Equation
text: We can factor $$y^2-8y+15=0$$ to use the zero product property. $$y^2-8y+15=(y-5)(y-3)=0$$
speech: We can factor  y squared minus 8 y plus 15 is equal to 0  to use the zero product property.  y squared, minus 8 y plus 15 is equal to parentheses y minus 5,  times, parentheses y minus 3,  is equal to 0
pacedSpeech: We can factor   y squared minus 8 y plus 15 is equal to 0
to use the zero product property.   y squared, minus 8 y plus 15 is equal to  y minus 5,  times,  y minus 3,  is equal to 0

title: Using the Zero Product Property
text: As per the zero product property, if $$(y-5)(y-3)$$, then either $$y-5$$ or $$y-3$$ is equal to $$0$$. Setting both of these to $$0$$, we get $$y=5$$ and $$x=3$$. Summing these values, we get $$8$$
speech: As per the zero product property, if  times, parentheses y minus 5,  times, parentheses y minus 3,  , then either  y minus 5  or  y, minus, 3  is equal to  0 . Setting both of these to  0 , we get  y is equal to 5  and  x, is equal to 3 . Summing these values, we get  8

, we get   y is equal to 5
